meanings.definition: To enclose or surround in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: The magician was insphering the rabbit in a crystal ball.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed insphering her favorite trinkets in glass spheres.
meanings.sent3: The artist insphered the paintbrush in a bubble, creating a whimsical masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The sun insphered the earth in its warm embrace, like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The child imagined insphering her dreams in a magical orb to keep them safe.

meanings.definition: To place or set in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: He carefully insphered the marble in the center of the circle.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler insphered the precious gemstone in a delicate globe pendant.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully insphered the cherry on top of the cake, making it look like a tiny planet.
meanings.sent4: The architect insphered the courtyard within the walls of the building, creating a hidden oasis.
meanings.sent5: She insphered her memories in a glass sphere, treasuring each one like a precious gem.
